title: Coinbase Global, Inc. $COIN Holdings Decreased by Raymond James Financial Inc.
text:
Coinbase Global, Inc. $COIN Holdings Decreased by Raymond James Financial Inc. Written by MarketBeat August 21, 2025 Share Link copied to clipboard. Key Points Raymond James Financial Inc. has reduced its holdings in Coinbase Global, Inc. by 10.8%, bringing its ownership to 420,455 shares valued at approximately $72.4 million. CEO Brian Armstrong sold a significant portion of his shares, totaling 336,265 shares, which represents a 99.84% decrease in his position. Coinbase Global's stock has experienced fluctuations with a 52-week range between $142.58 and $444.64, and recent news revealed a quarterly earnings miss with a revenue of $1.50 billion against estimates of $1.68 billion. Want stock alerts on Coinbase Global? Get 5 Weeks of MarketBeat All Access for $5. Get My Stock Alerts . Raymond James Financial Inc. decreased its holdings in shares of Coinbase Global, Inc. ( NASDAQ:COIN ) by 10.8% during the first quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The institutional investor owned 420,455 shares of the cryptocurrency exchange's stock after selling 51,040 shares during the quarter. Raymond James Financial Inc. owned 0.17% of Coinbase Global worth $72,414,000 as of its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
How Did Peter Thiel-Backed Crypto Exchange Bullish's IPO Go? A number of other institutional investors and hedge funds have also modified their holdings of the business. Vanguard Group Inc. grew its holdings in shares of Coinbase Global by 4.8% during the first quarter. Vanguard Group Inc. now owns 19,294,456 shares of the cryptocurrency exchange's stock valued at $3,323,084,000 after buying an additional 875,359 shares in the last quarter. ARK Investment Management LLC grew its stake in Coinbase Global by 1.1% in the first quarter. ARK Investment Management LLC now owns 3,069,107 shares of the cryptocurrency exchange's stock valued at $528,592,000 after purchasing an additional 34,462 shares in the last quarter. Northern Trust Corp grew its stake in Coinbase Global by 20.3% in the fourth quarter. Northern Trust Corp now owns 1,294,758 shares of the cryptocurrency exchange's stock valued at $321,488,000 after purchasing an additional 218,400 shares in the last quarter. UBS AM a distinct business unit of UBS ASSET MANAGEMENT AMERICAS LLC grew its stake in Coinbase Global by 29.5% in the fourth quarter. UBS AM a distinct business unit of UBS ASSET MANAGEMENT AMERICAS LLC now owns 979,129 shares of the cryptocurrency exchange's stock valued at $243,118,000 after purchasing an additional 222,789 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Charles Schwab Investment Management Inc. grew its stake in Coinbase Global by 1.8% in the first quarter. Charles Schwab Investment Management Inc. now owns 951,848 shares of the cryptocurrency exchange's stock valued at $163,937,000 after purchasing an additional 16,816 shares in the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 68.84% of the company's stock. Get Coinbase Global alerts: Sign Up Insider Buying and Selling at Coinbase Global
In related news, CEO Brian Armstrong sold 336,265 shares of the business's stock in a transaction dated Wednesday, June 25th. The stock was sold at an average price of $362.61, for a total transaction of $121,933,051.65. Following the completion of the transaction, the chief executive officer owned 526 shares of the company's stock, valued at approximately $190,732.86. The trade was a 99.84% decrease in their position. The transaction was disclosed in a document filed with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is accessible through this hyperlink . Over the last ninety days, insiders sold 1,185,704 shares of company stock worth $438,918,732. 23.43% of the stock is currently owned by insiders. Coinbase Global Price Performance Why Citigroup Analysts See Double-Digit Upside in Coinbase Stock
Shares of NASDAQ:COIN opened at $302.07 on Wednesday. Coinbase Global, Inc. has a fifty-two week low of $142.58 and a fifty-two week high of $444.64. The business has a 50-day moving average of $342.19 and a two-hundred day moving average of $261.45. The stock has a market capitalization of $77.61 billion, a P/E ratio of 29.21 and a beta of 3.70. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.25, a current ratio of 2.12 and a quick ratio of 2.13.
Coinbase Global ( NASDAQ:COIN - Get Free Report ) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Thursday, July 31st. The cryptocurrency exchange reported $0.12 earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $0.91 by ($0.79). Coinbase Global had a return on equity of 16.02% and a net margin of 40.87%.The company had revenue of $1.50 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $1.68 billion. During the same period in the prior year, the firm earned $0.14 EPS. Coinbase Global's quarterly revenue was up 3.3% on a year-over-year basis. On average, equities research analysts predict that Coinbase Global, Inc. will post 7.22 EPS for the current fiscal year. Analyst Ratings Changes 3 Surprising Earnings Winners Changing Their Market Narrative
COIN has been the topic of a number of recent research reports. HC Wainwright restated a "sell" rating and issued a $300.00 target price on shares of Coinbase Global in a research note on Friday, August 1st. Jefferies Financial Group boosted their target price on Coinbase Global from $260.00 to $405.00 and gave the company a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 29th. Oppenheimer restated an "outperform" rating and issued a $417.00 target price on shares of Coinbase Global in a research note on Thursday, July 31st. Wall Street Zen upgraded Coinbase Global from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Saturday, August 2nd. Finally, Williams Trading set a $405.00 target price on Coinbase Global in a research note on Thursday, July 31st. Thirteen research analysts have rated the stock with a Buy rating, ten have assigned a Hold rating and two have issued a Sell rating to the company's stock. According to data from MarketBeat.com, Coinbase Global presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $352.72.
Read Our Latest Report on COIN About Coinbase Global ( Free Report )
Coinbase Global, Inc provides financial infrastructure and technology for the crypto economy in the United States and internationally. The company offers the primary financial account in the crypto economy for consumers; and a marketplace with a pool of liquidity for transacting in crypto assets for institutions. Further Reading
